intro: Commelina harcocuskii, commonly known as the Hawaiian commelina, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes a variety of grass-like plants and ornamental species. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
